title: Introduction to Python
content:
What is Python?

Python is a versatile, beginner-friendly programming language used in web development, data science, automation, AI, and more.

Key Features

  • Easy to learn syntax
  • Open-source with vast libraries
  • Interpreted and dynamically typed

References

  • Official Python Website

title: Installing Python
content:
How to Install Python

  • Go to python.org/downloads
  • Download the installer for your OS
  • During install, check Add Python to PATH

Verify Installation

python --version

title: Your First Python Program
content:
Hello World

print("Hello, World!")

This prints a message to the screen.

title: Variables and Data Types
content:
Variables

name = "Alice"
age = 30
height = 5.6
is_student = True

Common Data Types

  • int – Integers
  • float – Decimal numbers
  • str – Strings (text)
  • bool – True or False

title: User Input and Type Casting
content:
Getting Input

name = input("Enter your name: ")
print("Hello, " + name)

Type Conversion

age = int(input("Enter your age: "))

title: Operators
content:
Arithmetic Operators

x = 5
y = 2
print(x + y, x - y, x * y, x / y, x % y)

Comparison & Logical Operators

print(x > y and y < 10)

title: Control Flow
content:
if-elif-else

score = 75
if score >= 90:
    print("A")
elif score >= 60:
    print("B")
else:
    print("Fail")

title: Loops
content:
For Loop

for i in range(5):
    print(i)

While Loop

count = 0
while count < 3:
    print(count)
    count += 1

title: Functions
content:
Defining Functions

def greet(name):
    print("Hello, " + name)

greet("Alice")

Return Values

def square(x):
    return x * x

title: String Manipulation
content:
String Methods

s = "python"
print(s.upper(), s.capitalize(), s.replace("p", "j"))

F-Strings

name = "Alice"
print(f"Hello, {name}!")

title: File Handling
content:
Read and Write Files

with open("file.txt", "w") as f:
    f.write("Hello File")

with open("file.txt") as f:
    print(f.read())

title: Error Handling
content:
Try Except Block

try:
    x = int("hello")
except ValueError:
    print("Conversion failed")

title: Classes and Objects
content:
OOP Basics

class Person:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name

    def greet(self):
        print(f"Hello, I'm {self.name}")

p = Person("Alice")
p.greet()

title: Modules and Packages
content:
Importing

import math
print(math.sqrt(16))

Custom Modules

# save as mymodule.py
def add(x, y):
    return x + y

# another file
from mymodule import add

title: Useful Built-in Functions
content:
• len() – Length of sequence
  • range() – Sequence of numbers
  • type() – Data type of object
  • int(), str(), list() – Type casting

title: Next Steps After Basics
content:
• Practice on LeetCode, HackerRank
  • Explore libraries like NumPy, Pandas
  • Build small projects like calculators, to-do apps, or file organizers
